Newcastle United owner Mike Ashley is in talks to sell the club to billionaire Sheikh Khaled bin Zayed Al Nehayan.

BBC

replies.msg:
Last year, Sheikh Khaled - the cousin of Manchester City owner Sheikh Mansour - made a £2billion offer to buy the Merseyside club from FSG in what would have been the most expensive takeover in the history of football.

However, he failed in his attempt to acquire the Merseyside club, which was a joint venture with a minority stake Chinese partner.

The Press Association reported last year that the offer "did not get past the vetting stage because it was deemed neither credible nor worthy of being put to the ownership."

Liverpool confirmed meetings did take place in New York between chairman Tom Werner and Midhat Kidwai, the managing director of Sheikh Khaled's conglomerate.
